body.p:
To his Excelency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned would respectfully Petition Your Excellency to reprieve Enoch Foley who was at the present March term of the Bath Circuit Court ^convicted^ of the Crime of Stealing hogs, Said Foley is a Young Man, is ignorant and illiterate, and was induced to participate in said Crime by another Man, who had great influence over him, and whom he greatly feared until he became intimate with the man who thus induced him to Commit said Crime he Sustained a good character and was an industrious thrifty Young man and that he is a young man of family and very poor and his family depend upon him for a support and in pardoning him You will receive the commendation of a majority of the citizens of Bath and the humble prayers of his family: March 24th 1860
